message_1:
What is the enthalpy change for the combustion of 1 mole of methane gas, CH4(g), given the following information: 

- Heat of formation of methane gas, ΔHf = -74.8 kJ/mol
- Equations for combustion of methane and related ΔH values:

   CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2 H2O(g)    ΔH = -891.1 kJ/mol
   
   2 H2(g) + O2(g) -> 2 H2O(g)                   ΔH = -483.7 kJ/mol
message_2:
The enthalpy change for the combustion of 1 mole of methane gas, CH4(g), is already given in the provided information:

CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2 H2O(g)    ΔH = -891.1 kJ/mol

So, the enthalpy change for the combustion of 1 mole of methane gas is -891.1 kJ/mol.
